cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 625 mi (1005 km) SE of Bermuda
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic, then turning northwest toward the southeastern U.S. coast (Carolinas) late Thursday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina / South Carolina coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern U.S. coastline from South Carolina northward to Virginia
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible (below gale force) late week as remnant circulation passes well to the south
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Great Lakes
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain possible this weekend from remnant moisture, but totals generally under 2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential supply-chain and intermodal delays for cargo arriving from East Coast seaports impacted by Florence
